name: Networks and Connections
description: Just like the expansive underground fungal network revealed in Fungi: The Web of Life, artistic collaboration creates an unseen network between artworks.

key_work.title: Fungi: The Web of Life
key_work.creator_credit: Gisela Kaufmann, Joseph Nizeti, Paul Phelan, David Gross, Jennifer Peedom, Jo-anne McGowan, Sarah Noonan, Definition Films, Stranger Than Fiction Films and Catherine Marciniak
key_work.brief_description: Much of life on Earth is connected by a vast, hidden network that we are only just beginning to understand. Out of sight, between the world of plants and animals, another world exists—the kingdom of fungi.

constellations_primary.name: Networks and Connections
constellations_primary.description: Just like the expansive underground fungal network revealed in Fungi: The Web of Life, artistic collaboration creates an unseen network between artworks.

start.title: Fungi: The Web of Life
start.creator_credit: Gisela Kaufmann, Joseph Nizeti, Paul Phelan, David Gross, Jennifer Peedom, Jo-anne McGowan, Sarah Noonan, Definition Films, Stranger Than Fiction Films and Catherine Marciniak

end.title: River
end.creator_credit: Jennifer Peedom, Joseph Nizeti, Simon Njoo, Jo-anne McGowan, John Smithson, Arrow Pictures, Dogwoof, River Production Pty Ltd, Stranger Than Fiction Films, Jen Peedom and Robert Macfarlane
end.brief_description: A cinematic and musical odyssey that explores the remarkable relationship between humans and rivers. Throughout history, rivers have shaped our landscapes and our journeys; flowed through our cultures and dreams. RIVER takes its audience on a journey through space and time; spanning six continents, and drawing on extraordinary contemporary cinematography, including satellite filming, the film shows rivers on scales and from perspectives never seen before. Its union of image, music and sparse, the poetic script will create a film that is both dream-like and powerful, honouring the wildness of rivers but also recognizes their vulnerability.

constellations_other.name: Networks and Connections
constellations_other.description: Just like the expansive underground fungal network revealed in Fungi: The Web of Life, artistic collaboration creates an unseen network between artworks.

constellations_other.name: Root, branch and vein
constellations_other.description: The Tides Within Us are a series of prints appearing in the exhibition Marshmallow Laser Feast: Works of Nature, which were created using medical imagery.

links.description: Fungi: The Web of Life is co-produced by Jennifer Peedom and Jo-Anne McGowan who co-produced the 2021 documentary River about the importance of the world’s network of river systems. Jennifer Peedom also co-directed River alongside Fungi writer Joseph Nizeti.

start.title: River
start.creator_credit: Jennifer Peedom, Joseph Nizeti, Simon Njoo, Jo-anne McGowan, John Smithson, Arrow Pictures, Dogwoof, River Production Pty Ltd, Stranger Than Fiction Films, Jen Peedom and Robert Macfarlane

RIVER takes its audience on a journey through space and time; spanning six continents, and drawing on extraordinary contemporary cinematography, including satellite filming, the film shows rivers on scales and from perspectives never seen before. Its union of image, music and sparse, the poetic script will create a film that is both dream-like and powerful, honouring the wildness of rivers but also recognizes their vulnerability.

end.title: Antichrist
end.creator_credit: Lars von Trier, Frauke Firl, Anders Refn, Meta Louise Foldager Sørensen, ARTE France Cinéma, DR, Film i Väst, Groupe Grand Accord, Lucky Red, Memfis Film, Slot Machine, SVT, Trollhättan Film, ZDF/Arte, Zentropa Entertainments, Zentropa International Köln, Zentropa International Poland and Karl Júlíusson
end.headline_credit: Denmark, France, Germany, Italy, Poland and Sweden, 2009
end.brief_description: A grieving couple retreats to their cabin ‘Eden’ in the woods, hoping to repair their broken hearts and troubled marriage. But nature takes its course and things go from bad to worse.

constellations_other.name: Outliers of the Hollywood Musical
constellations_other.description: It might feel like the musical genre has been having a rest since the golden age of cinema, but you only need to look at the enormous number of music videos that have been produced - especially since the launch of MTV in 1981 - to realise that it has not. These days, if we count narrative-based music videos, the overwhelming majority that are made are short, snappy and live outside of the Hollywood studio system.

constellations_other.name: Networks and Connections
constellations_other.description: Just like the expansive underground fungal network revealed in Fungi: The Web of Life, artistic collaboration creates an unseen network between artworks.

links.description: River featured narration by Willem Dafoe who had previously collaborated with director Lars von Trier for his 2009 film Antichrist.

links.description: Willem Dafoe starred alongside Charlotte Gainsbourg in Antichrist. Aside from her acting work, Charlotte Gainsbourg is also a musician who made her directorial debut in 2017 with a series of her own music videos including Deadly Valentine.

links.description: Musician Devonté Hynes who appears in Charlotte Gainsbourg’s music video for Deadly Valentine and who performs under the Blood Orange moniker has collaborated with many musicians. In 2012, Hynes co-wrote and co-produced Losing You with Solange. Solange has been vocal about her admiration for Björk.
